text:
- My name is Matt Alderdice
and I'm head of Data Science
at Sonrai Analytics.

Sonrai is a Queens
University Belfast spinoff.
We were founded in 2018

and we're a precision medicine
AI cloud technology company.

We develop AI products
for biotech and pharma
so that they can make sense of their data,
ultimately to make drug discoveries,

get them to patients quicker,
and improve patient outcomes.
We sell into the US market primarily,
but we are a global company.
We sell to biotech and pharma,
but also diagnostics companies.
We are exploring new markets.
AWS has provided us lots of data regions

and we're gonna be moving
into the Middle East.

We're using AWS technologies
to automate the detection
of cancer,
so replacing or augmenting certain roles
within precision medicine workflows.
We're gonna be using AWS to process

what we refer to as Omic data,
so one of the new services.

AWS Health Omics is
something that we're planning

to invest heavily with and
we are an early adopter.
- Hi, I'm Gerald Loughran.

I'm the head of engineering
at Sonrai Analytics,
and we are a company that provides data

and AI services to pharma
and biotech companies.
We help companies develop drugs quicker,
make new interesting discoveries,

and ultimately are
fighting against cancer.

Our customers have
problems such as being able
to manage lots of bulky data.

They can't afford to run
expensive compute processes,

and we provide 'em a
trusted research environment
that meets regulatory standards

so that they can essentially
develop cancer therapeutics

or develop new drugs at potentially
a fraction of the price.

And also to de-risk when
they get the clinical trial.
With AWS, we're able to apply serverless
event driven architecture that allows us
to handle various complicated data types.

It allows us to automate really
time expensive processes.

It allows, for example, our
clients to get to market
six to twelve months quicker
when it comes to algorithm development.

And we're doing all of this
through integrated AWS services.

Sonrai is currently engaged
primarily in the United States,
Europe, UK, and Ireland.

We've also got opportunities
in the Middle East and Asia.
But also in terms of new opportunities,

we're pushing into new
fields within our domain,

such as using health Omics
to generate bulk data

and looking at foundational
models for imaging.
So we're expanding what we deliver
to our current customers as well.

We have access to a
great AWS support team.
We get regular access to training.
We get beta access to new programs,
for example, health Omics.

This allows us to kinda
get a competitive edge

and to learn new technologies
and then we ultimately
put that back into our client solutions.
The biggest focus for us currently
is dealing with processed end data,
which is very bulky, very difficult.
We've been working with AWS

to make this potentially go
from costing $2,000 a run
to $22, which could be the difference

between being able to
develop a drug or not.

And we're also pushing
heavily into the imaging space

for our own foundation
model, which would allow us
to develop brand new cancer diagnostics.

Sonrai has made massive
strides in the last year
with regards to developing brand new
cutting edge tools for biotech and pharma.

And this year we're hoping to
massively extend our growth

by pushing into new
regions and new domains.

And we've also recently made
massive cost optimization

approaches that we think
will make massive scalability
improvements across healthcare.
